ratings.question_text: Your level of engagement with the course was:
What is your overall assessment of this course?
The course was well organized to facilitate student learning.
I received clear feedback that improved my learning.
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the level of intellectual challenge of this course was:
Relative to other courses you have taken at Yale, the workload of this course was:

narratives.question_text: What knowledge, skills, and insights did you develop by taking this course?
comments: I learned about the different ways in which people might be represented politically, and more so how we are actually represented or not within the US.

A deeper knowledge of how elections and actual representation takes place in the US. Provided micro-studies but also a more broad view of the state of representation in the US from the Constitution to the most recent election.
theories behind political representation and personal anecdotes from amir and my classmates.

This course gave me the opportunity to think about the state of political representation today and what political representation could/should look like. I don't know that I gained any particular insights. More so, I had the opportunity to think deeply about my observations and concerns.
All about the different systems of representation that affect our political and governmental systems today
We learned about approaches to analyzing political representation and asking ourselves what politics may look like otherwise.
I gained a extensive understanding of the dimensions, limitations, and implications of representative democracy.

narratives.question_text: What are the strengths and weaknesses of this course and how could it be improved?
comments: Prof Fairdosi is one of the best at Yale. He knows how to engage a class and you can tell he really cares about his students and their wellbeing. This class reflects his values and is a great engaging experience for all. I liked the clear feedback he always gave and how he considered every view point.

great and manageable readings, lively class discussions, and amir is such a gem. he has the ability to explain complex theories into simple words that anyone could understand. he alone is worth it to take the class

The strengths of this course were the workload. Readings and assignments felt manageable. 

This course's readings were largely outdated, which made it difficult to draw relevant conclusions about our political system today. I don't think our discussions were always as targeted or focused as they could have been. We spent a lot of time talking about the media and polarization even those two topics were not on our syllabus. I think there could have been a way to better tailor the syllabus to our contemporary political system. That might have made discussions more focused and animated.

Strengths: interesting topics and readings that connect to each other from week to week, and lively weekly discussions facilitated by Professor Fairdosi
Weaknesses: at time a bit disorganized but not to a fault
This was a great course with a great professor. All love for professor Fairdosi.

The strengths of this course is that it provides a broad though in depth survey of representative government and constituent-legislator relationships in America. Another strength is that Professor Fairdosi provides a lecture prior to the seminar discussion, which clarifies and supplements the course readings and themes. Professor Fairdosi also provides clear expectations and feedback to optimize student success in the course. (i.e. outlining ways to structure an academic paper and thesis statement).

narratives.question_text: Would you recommend this course to another student? Please explain.
comments: If you want to learn a lot in a low-stakes environment, there's no better course.
Yes. I will take every class I can with Fairdosi. I would follow him to the ends of the Earth.

If this counts towards your major or you enjoy the topic, Prof. Fairdosi is a great professor and the class will not ask much of you. If you are looking for a rigorous course to get lots out of, I would take a different class. However, I enjoyed going to class each week and would recommend this course if you need something lighter and interesting.
Yes. My time in a class with Professor Fairdosi was the absolute highlight of my time at Yale.

Yes!! please take a course with Amir. He is a fantastic seminar leader and explains concepts extremely well. the welcoming class environment makes it easy to participate, and amir is there to hear whatever you have to say. take it!
I'd recommend this course if you're looking for a low-stakes political science/EPE credit.
Absolutely! Very interesting to think about political representation from a more theoretical standpoint
of course, this course was simple and effective.

Yes, I would absolutely recommend this course to another student. This course provided me with greater insights into the study of political representation and Professor Fairdosi's lectures expanded my knowledge on representative democracy and associated political science scholarship.
